Missionaries Must Be Committed to the Work
     THE FOLLOWING LETTER WAS WRITTEN TO ELDER AND MRS. I. J. VAN HORN, WHO HAD GONE TO OREGON AS MISSIONARIES. ADELIA PATTON HAD LIVED IN THE WHITE HOME FOR SEVERAL YEARS PRIOR TO HER MARRIAGE TO ISAAC VAN HORN, AND WAS LIKE A DAUGHTER TO THEM. ELDER AND MRS. WHITE HAD HIGH HOPES AND EXPECTATIONS THAT, WORKING TOGETHER, THE VAN HORNS WOULD MAKE A MIGHTY MISSIONARY TEAM. THEIR HOPES WERE SHORT-LIVED.
